p:
We have established in our previous studies that the Mn catalyst binds O 2 to generate a Mn( iii)-superoxide, which is reduced to a hydroperoxide with proton transfer at more negative potentials.
15 Since the potential for the reduction of this Mn( iii)-superoxide intermediate overlaps with the reduction of BQ under these conditions, we propose that the observed co-electrocatalysis arises from an intermolecular reaction as summarized in eqn (7).
72[HQ(TFEOH) 3(TFEO) 2] 2− + [Mn III(L(H))O 2˙ −] + ⇌ 2[BQ] 0 + [Mn II(L(H))] + + 4[TFEO] − + 2H 2O + 6TFEOH
